title: Random maintenance, no ETA in "service status" or "red tracker." Gj Rito.
body:
If I go downstairs to eat and watch 2 episodes of Stargate on TV, I kind of expect the servers to be back up when I come back. If it's gonna be longer than 2 hours, I kind of expect some sort of communication beforehand, you know?

http://i.imgur.com/dy9z6EX.png[/img]

replies.body: your comment made me check. I just assumed it was still down. Thank you!!! {{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}
Yea, feels like Riot keeps pulling the old bugs bunny pie in the face, honk the nose and squirt water in our face as they laugh 'HEUK HEUK HEUK HEUK'

Hmmm...this is something I'm going to make a note of to see what we can do in the future.  Here's some more nitty gritty details though:

At the end of the day, I made a call not to create a Boards thread about the maintenance.  This was actually routine maintenance that is completed every few weeks, and since it was occurring at 3am (super off peak hours), I made the decision that there isn't too much to discuss in a Boards thread and the Server Status Page/Ticker should be enough communication.

That being said, we can definitely look at ways to improve that communication, such as giving a really rough ETA.  We hate doing this though because in the world of IT and maintenance, things can go very wrong and estimates get tossed out the window.  If we say it will take 2 hours, but ends up taking 4 hours, we are not only letting players down but expectations are going to seriously be outta wack.  I still think there's a solution here though.

Something else to clarify as well:

* Stargate SG1 is better than Atlantis
* People need to know that Colonel/General Jack O'Neill is spelled with two "L"s
* Stargate Universe was much better than people give it credit for

Judging from the way you guys handle patches, don't you tend to overestimate anyway? (eg: saying it will take 6 hours when it only takes 1 or 2).

It shouldn't really be an issue if you stick with that. With no ETA at all, and the server still down 4 hours later.... For all we know it coulda been a 12 hour maintenance at that point.

And yes, SG1 is the best. The only reason Atlantis is good is because.... It continued to have new episodes after SG1 got cancelled :(

Yeah, I definitely get where you are coming from.  12 hour maintenance's are incredibly rare and if we had one, it means we seriously fucked up a lot of other things leading up to this point.  Albeit, point noted.  We don't try to over-estimate too terribly much (6 hours for 1-2 is a little extreme), but similar to battle plans, the moment a maintenance start, all ETA's can sometimes be immediately tossed out a window.  We need to figure out a good solution for this though!

I believe that was the beginning time of the maintenance. 3am PDT, 5am Central. No clarification on how long it would last.

Seriously, I have been waiting for hours. Would it be too much to ask for to get an estimated time to have the servers back up? Some type of update or anything? Or am I just going to continue to wait with no idea of how much longer I will have to wait?
I wonder when this maintenance was announced. Also strange that a planned maintenance doesn't even have an expected time.
